messages.title: A long record of local action
messages.content: Rosie Sharpley has been getting things done for local people for more than thirty years — almost helped everyone. Rosie has worked as a nurse in the NHS caring for the most vulnerable residents.

messages.title: 21 years of helping local people
messages.content: A record of action Protecting local services Fight for health service Investing in our future More money in your pocket

messages.title: Investing in our children’s future
messages.content: As someone who has raised her family here, Rosie understands the true value of our children, the most important group in life and a clean, safe environment to grow up in.

messages.title: Saving our local health services
messages.content: As a nurse Rosie knows how important the local health services. Rosie has pledged to fight the loss of Woking’s Community Hospital Beds especially in Woking.

messages.title: Protecting local services
messages.content: Nothing matters more to Rosie than protecting and improving vital local services we all rely on.

messages.title: More money back in your pocket
messages.content: The Lib Dem tax cuts for those on low and middle pays will result in the first £10,000 (£10,000 next year) of your income being tax-free.

messages.title: Cleaning up British politics: My contract with the people of Woking and the surrounding villages
messages.content: I will put local people first. I will be there to help and listen to your concerns and stand up for our community.

messages.title: My contract with the people of Woking and the surrounding villages
messages.content: I will make sure your voice is heard - locally and at Westminster. I will be a strong voice for Woking and the surrounding villages.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dem tax cuts for those on low and middle pays will increase the tax-free personal allowance to £10,000, aiming to put money back into people's pockets.
The Lib Dems will invest in schools by reducing class sizes and abolishing Labour’s unfair tuition fees.
Commitment to renewable energy, to make Britain a world leader in renewable technology.
Rosie Sharpley has pledged to fight for the preservation of Woking’s Community Hospital Beds.

issues.economy: Lib Dem tax cuts for those on low and middle pays will result in the first £10,000 of your income being tax-free.
issues.education: The Lib Dems will invest in schools by reducing class sizes and abolishing Labour’s unfair tuition fees.
issues.environment: Commitment to making Britain greener with renewable energy.
issues.health: Rosie, with her experience as a nurse, is fighting to save local health services and is opposed to the loss of Woking’s Community Hospital Beds.
